Topic.Title: by sept 15 amzn will be below 260

Message.Msg: I have no idea where the stock will be but I intend to think lower. Other retailers are getting much better at online retailing and integrating their big box stores into the sales mix. Price matching technology makes it easy to compete so there is very little reason for consumers who once visited big box retailers to just kick the tires and then go buy on amzn to repeat that behavior anymore. If I can walk out of the store with product in hand why wouldn't I? Groceries, come on, really?

Topic.Title: if mafia won't pump spx above 1652 level by next Tuesday

Message.Msg: I like gold and cash as believe it will protect real purchasing power in both inflationary and deflationary scenarios. Outside of that, the only argument is what is RELATIVELY more fairly valued. There, I like AAPL and GOOG (nice to have $50B-$150B cash buffer, generate insane cash flow each year and be a natural currency hedge). When Mahaney and the analyst crew were bashing Google/Page at $540, I was saying Google would hit $1000 before AAPL. Google has created real options to enter and dominate very large markets should it choose to (of course, it would face even more scrutiny). We are likely to face a "deflationary" swoosh before "inflation" sets in. I'd rather hold assets that are well positioned to not only survive said event, but benefit from it. IMHO, almost every SECURITIZED (stocks, bonds, real estate) asset is currently either overpriced or in a bubble. So, I am focusing my time on private technology companies with unique IP positions relevant to the sectors of the economy that will grow in relative terms in the future (even if is contraction from where we are today). So, I find it difficult to be "long" any of them.

Topic.Title: -AMZN GOES BROKE WITHIN 2-3 YRS--BEZOS ULTIMATE DREAMER

Message.Msg: Once AMZN is forced to collect state tax, AMZN business model is finished. Bezos should have bought Best Buy while they were cheap. But he has neither wisdom nor vision to save Amazon back in 2011. Instead he was obsessed with the personal toys like Washington Post or space exploration project. The only weapon AMZN ever had and only matters is the price advantage. Now Target and Best Buy have price matching and the convience to return defective items, Amazon can't survive another 2 years as big states are all forcing Amazon to collect tax. Amazon could buy a chain to have physical presence, but now all chained stores are too expensive to buy. Another big bad for Bezos is that he never saved pennies for rainy days. He made little money and used them to build warehouses. Amazon has no cash reserve to buy chain stores now even her life depends on it.

Message.Title: Insiders basically selling 100% of options exercised... while fund managers playing with your money add...
Message.Msg: Basically has dumped twice as much this year as last year. He's now cut his holding in half from peak levels of Feb 15th last year, so he's selling quite a bit more than being awarded. Looks like he's not so bullish on AMZN. Wise man. Jeff Blackburn simply takes 50% off the table as he goes... David Z unloads his entire option exercise each quarter and holds nothing on an ongoing basis... Tom Szkutak has effectively sold 100% of what he's exercised since last August... Brian Valentine has reduced his holdings by 50% since last Sept, despite exercising 10K more shares... Shelley Reynolds has sold 100% of what she's exercise since last August... But, don't worry. The folks taking a tax on your retirement accounts to pay themselves are busy loading up while the insiders have systematically cut their LT holdings in Amazon over the past few years, despite continually being issued new shares...

Topic.Title: if mafia won't pump spx above 1652 level by next Tuesday

Message.Msg: I'm saying to own some (physical) gold for the longer term. The mafia needs to tank the market so that gold will be a source of funds which they can then buy to rebuild gold reserves. But, the problem for them is that there are much better sources of funds -- Scamazon is overvalued by 4-5X, so why sell gold when you can get out of Scamazon? Same is true for every float jam scam. The 8-10% overall drop will be 20-50% drop in scams and neutral to slight gains in real investments that are holding value despite near record short interest. The big boys have already spent almost a year stuffing the passive funds / index trackers full of Scamazon and other #$%$.
